channel.title: Ushome | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - all the latest US news, showbiz, science, sport and health stories from the Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Slender Man girls, 13, appear in court as judge rules they will be tried as adults for grisly attempted murder
item.description: Keeping them in the adult system would protect the public, ruled Waukesha County, Wisconsin Circuit Judge Michael Bohren.

item.title: Slender Man girls, 13, appear in court as judge rules they will be tried as adults for grisly attempted murder
item.description: Keeping them in the adult system would protect the public, ruled Waukesha County, Wisconsin Circuit Judge Michael Bohren.

item.title: Melissa Gilbert runs for Congress in Michigan but owes $472,000 in back taxes
item.description: Republican incumbent Mike Bishop's campaign mocked her right away: 'Melissa Gilbert can afford to have a stylist for her dog, but cannot pay her taxes.'
item.media:description: David Martosko

item.title: Has Queen Nefertiti been found? Scientist claims to have discovered a secret door to her burial chamber in Tutankhamun’s tomb
item.description: Dr Nicholas Reeves, an English archaeologist at the University of Arizona, says he made the discovery after analysing high-resolution radar scans of the walls of Tutankhamun's grave.

item.title: Pod of Orca calves swim past a group of freedivers in New Zealand
item.description: Freedivers swimming in Little Barrier, in the northeastern coast of New Zealand, were surprised when a pod of Orcas did laps around them while hunting.

item.title: US rowers fall ill at test event for 2016 Olympics amid concern about water
item.description: Seventeen rowers - 13 teenage athletes and four staffers - on a 40-member U.S. team reported stomach illnesses at the World Junior Rowing Championships - a trial run for next year's Games.

item.title: White House staffer Barvetta Singletary arrested after 'firing gun at boyfriend'
item.description: Barvetta Singletary, 37, a special assistant to President Obama and the House legislative affairs liaison, was arrested on Friday following the incident.

item.title: Ferguson protesters arrested on anniversary of Michael Brown's death
item.description: Protesters shut down Interstate 70 outside of Ferguson in both directions during rush-hour traffic on Monday to mark the Michael Brown shooting anniversary.

item.title: Meet the ex-fundamentalist Mormon who left Warren Jeffs' sect
item.description: Mark Davis, an ex-fundamentalist Mormon, is the brains behind a revolutionary device that allows smartphone users to project apps for use on most surfaces.

item.title: Mad Men fans pay big bucks for auctioned-off items from the set
item.description: Set items from the hit show were auctioned off by Screen Bid last week. The props that earned the highest bids were all used by Jon Hamm's character, Don Draper - including his flask.

item.title: Kim Richards frowns in mugshot after Target shoplifting arrest
item.description: The former Real Housewives Of Beverly Hills star was allegedly caught stealing more than $600 worth of items on August 2.
item.media:description:
EXCLUSIVE: **NO USA TV AND NO USA WEB** MINIMUM FEE APPLY*These are the photos from the Kim's Van Nuys Target spree. Kim reportedly had loaded 2 shopping carts of toys and beauty products and attempted to leave without paying for the items.

Pictured: Kim Richard Booking photo
Ref: SPL1098963 100815 EXCLUSIVE

item.title: Delta Airlines flight captain’s call to say windshield had been smashed by hail
item.description: A Delta plane from Boston to Salt Lake City was forced to make an emergency landing in Denver on Friday as hail shattered the plane’s front windshield and damaged the nose cone.

item.title: Google rebrands under Alphabet to control its growing businesses
item.description: Google Inc is changing its operating structure by setting up a new company called Alphabet Inc, which will include the search business and a number of other units.

item.title: World trade center BASE jumpers receive $2k fines and community service
item.description: Andrew Rossig, 34, James Brady, 33, and Marko Markovich, 28, parachuted off the 104-story building in September 2013. Brady and Rossig were given at least 200 hours.

item.title: Men who eat high level of processed meat, less likely to become a father
item.description: Men who ate the most processed meat had a 28 per cent lower fertilisation rate when undergoing IVF than those who ate the least, according to a study by the American Society for Reproductive Medicine.

item.title: Heath Ledger's journal he kept while preparing for the Joker revealed
item.description: The film, which details the late actor's extraordinary preparation for his career defining role as The Joker in 2008 film The Dark Knight, was originally previewed in 2012.

item.title: Why Black Sails is more accurate than Pirates Of the Caribbean
item.description: Whilst Johnny Depp’s portrayal of the savvy pirate may be cinema gold, historian Angus Kosham maintains that the truth about real seafarers is much darker.
item.media:description: Television programme: Black Sails, starring Toby Stephens as Captain James Flint.

item.title: Hillary Clinton pitches $350 BILLION program to fight college loan debt
item.description: $35 billion per year would flow mostly to states in exchange for paring back tuition at public universities and making community college free. The money would come from tax hikes on the rich.
item.media:description: EXETER, NH - AUGUST 10: Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton gestures after taking questions from reporters following a town hall meeting at Exeter High School August 10, 2015 in Exeter, New Hampshire. Clinton answered questions about Donald Trump's recent comments regarding women. (Photo by Darren McCollester/Getty Images)

item.title: NFL stars played football as children have altered brain structures
item.description: Scientists led by Boston University School of Medicine Dr Julie Stamm said that repeated hits to the head during the preteen years was associated with changes to the corpus callosum.

item.title: Arizona police show up on first day of school to support two children of murdered cop
item.description: Phoenix Police Officer Travis Murphy was killed in the line of duty in 2010. His daughter Kaylee was only two-years-old and his son Kody born two weeks before.

item.title: John Ralston Pate found murdered in Caracas home and his girlfriend injured
item.description: An American expatriate lawyer was slain and his girlfriend wounded in an attack at his home in the Venezuelan capital, authorities and family members said Monday.

item.title: How doctors protect their families from infection
item.description: We live in a miasma of bacteria. Many are clearly harmless, but others can cause serious infections and health problems. So how can you best protect yourself?
item.media:description: ACAC3T dog on sofa

item.title: Benedict Cumberbatch is right about phone cameras writes JAN MOIR
item.description: The illicit recording of any live performance on a phone or tablet is a real problem for theatre-goers and actors alike, one that is getting steadily worse, writes Daily Mail columnist JAN MOIR.

item.title: Ronda Rousey markets T-shirts with her signature slogan for charity
item.description: Defending herself against haters who have called her 'too manly', Ronda said that her mother taught her not to be a D.N.B.: a 'Do Nothing B***h'. Now she's selling t-shirts with the catchphrase.

item.title: How patients who believe in God 'cope better' with cancer
item.description: US researchers found that people with greater faith claimed to have better physical health, a greater ability to carry on doing everyday tasks and fewer physical symptoms of cancer and its treatment.

item.title: Three French students are arrested for killing a Eva Bourseau then dissolving body in acid
item.description: Eva Bourseau's decomposing body was found by her mother in a plastic container in her flat in Toulouse, south west France, two days after she was allegedly murdered by the men.

item.title: What happened to the lost colonists of Roanoke?
item.description: Two teams of archaeologists have uncovered artefacts, such as pottery and jewellery, that may help reveal how 'lost colonists' disappeared from a sandy outpost on Roanoke Island.

item.title: Photographer reveals shocking amount of sugar 'hiding' in soft drinks
item.description: Henry Hargreaves, a food photographer and artist based in Brooklyn, created a visual, candy representation of the amount of sugar found in some of your favorite sweetened beverages.

item.title: 'My network would kill in a New York minute to have Megyn Kelly anchor the evening news!' The laser-sharp blonde is clear winner in Republican debate as top TV execs scramble to lure her away from Fox
item.description: Following her success at Thursday's Republican presidential debate, Kelly has become the hottest property in TV news, with top execs from NBC to CNN vying for her attention.

item.title: A bedtime glass of milk can ruin your child's teeth
item.description: Angela Debley, 40, from Bracknell, discovered son Fin, then eight, (right) had developed two cavities in his milk teeth in six months.

item.title: Virginia alcohol agents cleared in arrest of student claiming racism
item.description: Three Virginia liquor agents who were caught on camera violently arresting a university student have been cleared of wrongdoing and returned to work Monday.

item.title: How much you could be making by selling discontinued foods on eBay
item.description: Hundreds of discontinued or soon-to-be-discontinued food items are selling for tens, and even hundreds, of dollars on sites like eBay and Amazon.

item.title: Yellowstone National Park rangers catch grizzly bear suspected in hiker's death
item.description: The body of Lance Crosby, - an experienced hiker from Billings, Montana, who had worked in Yellowstone for the last five seasons - was found on Friday near Lake Village after he went hiking alone off-trail on Thursday.

item.title: Mother Jody Herring who 'shot dead social worker' pleads NOT GUILTY
item.description: Judy Herring, 40, (pictured) is charged in the slaying of a Vermont social worker after losing custody of her daughter. She has entered a not guilty plea at her court arraignment Monday in Barre, Vermont.

item.title: Hugo Chavez's ambassador daughter is Venezuela's richest woman
item.description: Maria Gabriela Chavez, 35, the late president's second-oldest daughter, holds assets in American and Andorran banks totaling almost $4.2billion, Diario las Americas reports.

item.title: Never before seen pictures of Prince Charles and Diana's 1981 wedding
item.description: Whispering words of encouragement to her five-year-old bridesmaid, Princess Diana looks resplendent in her wedding dress as she carries the girl through Buckingham Palace.

item.title: Google to launch $50 handset as Android One 'didn't meet expectations'
item.description: Though no details have been released about the new version, coming 'in the next few weeks', Google's South East Asia managing director Rajan Anandan said it will be priced between $31 and $47.
item.media:description: Google's lead designer for "Inbox by Gmail" Jason Cornwell shows the app's functionalities on a nexus 6 android phone during a media preview in New York on October 29, 2014. Google ramped up its mobile arsenal, upgrading its Nexus line with a new tablet and smartphone, and unveiling its revamped Android software, to be dubbed "Lollipop." The US tech giant also announced the launch of a streaming media player for music, movies and videos, which can also allow users to play games via the Android TV device. AFP PHOTO/Jewel Samad (Photo credit should read JEWEL SAMAD/AFP/Getty Images)

item.title: Photographer captures harvest mouse balancing between wheat
item.description: The moment a tiny harvest mouse scurried up stalks of wheat and balanced perfectly between them has been captured in a series of stunning photographs taken in Knowsley Safari Park.

item.title: Jackass' Steve-O live streams reckless 'SeaWorld sucks' stunt on LA crane
item.description: Because the first responders were not sure whether he needed to be rescued, five ambulances, a helicopter and more than 80 firefighters went to the scene of the stunt in LA on Sunday night.
item.media:description: Steve O stunt, climbs a crane with a blow-up killer whale.

item.title: The universe is DYING: Astronomers unveil stark new evidence
item.description: Energy generated by the galaxies is only half what it was two billion years ago - and fading steadily, according to the results of a survey using seven of the world's most powerful telescopes.
item.media:description: This composite picture shows how a typical galaxy appears at different wavelengths in the GAMA survey. This huge project has measured the energy output of more than 200 000 galaxies and represents the most comprehensive assessment of the energy output of the nearby Universe. The results confirm that the energy produced in a section of the Universe today is only about half what it was two billion years ago and find that this fading is occurring across all wavelengths from the ultraviolet to the far infrared.

item.title: Star Wars: The Force Awakens new teaser gives glimpse of First Order
item.description: The new teaser, released in South Korea, opens with a breathtaking shot of thousands upon thousands of officers and Stormtroopers standing in endless rows of phalanx formation

item.title: Jayceon Chrystie who died was 'black and blue' when father Daniel Cox left him
item.description: Jayceon Christie died Saturday in Louisville and the boy's father, Daniel Cox, 35, now faces a murder charge. During his first court appearance Monday, a judge set his bond at $500,000.

item.title: Bangladeshi woman, 23, attacked with acid
item.description: Ripa Rani Pandit, 23, has been left with permanent facial scars and horrific internal injuries after being tortured with the burning liquid as part of an alleged eight-month campaign of abuse.

item.title: Bizarre beauty trend sees women creating press-on manicures filled with oil and glitter
item.description: If you've ever looked at your manicure and thought, 'There isn't enough movement in there,' this over-the-top new nail trend is the answer to all of your problems.

item.title: Conspiracy theorists spot yet another UFO hovering above ISS
item.description: Footage allegedly taken from a Nasa camera shows a pink and white object soaring across space. It has reignited claims the ISS is being 'monitored by extra-terrestrials'.

item.title: Body found in search for Annie Lennox's daughter's missing boyfriend
item.description: Police in Dutchess County, New York, said they had found a body on Monday afternoon in the water near where Ian Jones, 32, Tali Lennox's missing boyfriend, was last seen on Saturday.

item.title: Leaning postboxes of Taipei are surprise hit with tourists after Typhoon Soudelor
item.description: Hundreds have queued up to have their photograph taken with the colourful mail boxes in Taipei, Taiwan, which both now lean to one side after being battered by Typhoon Soudelor at the weekend.

item.title: A car MELTS in the sun during a heatwave of 100F in Italy
item.description: John Westbrook said he was astonished when he saw the Renault Megane dripping as it was parked opposite a beach in the coastal town of Caorle in northern Italy, as temperatures hit 37C.

item.title: Astronaut Chris Hadfield's hilarious response on Q&A whether he got travel expenses
item.description: Canadian astronaut Chris Hadfield would be one incredibly wealthy man if he could claim travel allowance for the 166 days that he time spent in space.

item.title: Disney apologizes over tweet on Nagasaki A-bomb anniversary
item.description: Walt Disney Japan apologized Monday after a tweet sent from its corporate Twitter account wished readers 'congratulations on a not special day'.
item.media:description: DISNEY JAPAN TWITTER apology

item.title: New Jersey man, Nader Saadeh, planned to recruit a small army to join ISIS
item.description: Nader Saadeh is set to appear in US District Court in Newark after his morning arrest Monday on charges he attempted to provide support to ISIS, with authorities alleging he tried to form a small army.

item.title: President Robert Mugabe says his people 'failed to protect' Cecil, on World Lion Day
item.description: Zimbabwe President Robert Mugabe blamed his own people for Cecil the lion's death, in a speech today. Animals rights campaigners are also celebrating the first World Lion Day.

item.title: Drug dealer reveals how he grooms Brits like Peru Two to smuggle cocaine into Europe
item.description: Two years after Britons Michaella McCollum and Melissa Reid were jailed for trying to smuggle £1.5m of cocaine from Peru to Spain, a C4 show reveals how drug deals convince Brits to be mules.

item.title: Virginia Wesleyan College requested rape victim list the names all sexual partners
item.description: The private liberal arts school in Norfolk, Virginia, has requested the information from the woman, who is suing on the grounds the school failed to protect her against a sexual assault.

item.title: China has been hacking top US officials since 2010 according to officials and documents
item.description: Chinese hackers have been accessing the private emails of 'many' top US national security and trade officials since April 2010 and every top-ranking officeholder was targeted by the hacking scheme.

item.title: Inside Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux's wedding: Jimmy Kimmel officiated
item.description: Howard Stern has revealed details about the secret wedding between Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux, including that Jimmy Kimmel officiated.
item.media:description: (FILES) Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux arrive for the 2015 Vanity Fair Oscar Party in Beverly Hills, California, in this February 22, 2015, file photo. Celebrity magazine People reports on August 6, 2015, that the couple married in a private wedding on August 5. AFP PHOTO/ADRIAN SANCHEZ-GONZALEZ/FILES

item.title: Seven-year-old boy performs rendition of Taylor Swift's Shake It Off
item.description: Dylan, who is from Overland Park, Kansas, was filmed singing and dancing to the 25-year-old pop star's catchy song, using his family's fire place and living room as the stage for his performance.

item.title: Donald Trump hammers Jeb in Instagram video mocking first two Bush POTUSes
item.description: Circus music accompanies footage of George H.W. Bush's infamous 'Read my lips' moment and mocks George W. Bush for Iraq war's futile search for weapons of mass destruction.
item.media:description: Republican presidential hopeful Donald Trump speaks during the prime time Republican presidential primary debate on August 6, 2015 at the Quicken Loans Arena in Cleveland, Ohio. AFP PHOTO/MANDEL NGANMANDEL NGAN/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Elon Musk tempts fate in death-defying stunt
item.description: Over the weekend, Elon Musk and his wife, Talulah Riley, stepped onto the wings of a plane as it cruised through the sky over Hampshire, England at 130mph (210 km/h).

item.title: Warren Buffett signs biggest deal of his life to snap up aircraft parts group for £24bn just days before his 85th birthday
item.description: The billionaire US investor snapped up aircraft parts and engineering group Precision Castparts whic has 14 British sites and claims to manufacture bits of every aircraft flying today.

item.title: Married Tea Party lawmaker refuses to resign after state capital 'mafia' exposes his plan to release fake story about himself having sex with a gay prostitute to cover up his affair with a female colleague
item.description: Todd Courser, a representative from Lapeer, Michigan, in the state's House, said that he was the victim of blackmail forcing him into 'submitting to the authority of the establishment machine'.

item.title: Inside the life of football great Frank Gifford
item.description: Ethel Kennedy was devastated by the news of Gifford's sudden death. They dated after Sen. Robert Kennedy, was assassinated in 1968. 'Mrs. Kennedy was crazy about Frank – big-time.'

item.title: IKEA stabbing in Sweden leaves two dead
item.description: A third victim, a man in his mid-30s, is fighting for his life in hospital after the attack, which reportedly took place in the cutlery section at an IKEA in Västerås, central Sweden.
item.media:description: A police office talks to customers outside the Ikea store in Vasteras, Sweden, Monday Aug. 10, 2015, after three people were injured in a knife attack at the store. (Peter Kruger/TT via AP) SWEDEN OUT

item.title: Kelly Rutherford speaks out over bitter custody battle
item.description: TMZ revealed on Monday the actress has to attend a hearing in New York after German businessman David Giersch contacted a New York judge.
item.media:description: 10 August 2015-NYC-USA **** STRICTLY NOT AVAILABLE FOR USA *** Actress Kelly Rutherford has broken her silence on the accusations that she has kidnapped her own children by saying that she will not send her children back to Monaco to live with their father because the children are 'her priority' Talking exclusively to ABC News about the situation in which her ex-husband Daniel Giersch is accusing the actress of 'child abduction and extortion' after Rutherford refused to send her two children back to Monaco as part of a custody fight deal. The feuding pair have been in a bitter custody war for years after a California judge ruled that the two kids, Helena, six, and son Hermes, eight, should initially live with their father in Monaco. Giersch let the children spend two weeks with their mother Rutherford this summer during the school holidays but the actress is now refusing to send the pair back to their father. Rutherford, almost reduced to tears told ABC: "My first priority obviously

item.title: First big post-debate poll shows Donald Trump GAINED 7 points and sits at 32%
item.description: No one is anywhere near The Donald, with Jeb Bush in second place at just 11 per cent. The poll was supervised by a former Washington Post journalist and shows no one else in double digits.
item.media:description: Real estate tycoon Donald Trump (R) and Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker (L) arrive on stage for the Republican presidential primary debate on August 6, 2015 at the Quicken Loans Arena in Cleveland, Ohio. AFP PHOTO / MANDEL NGANMANDEL NGAN/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Teenage girl, 19, is killed and 11 others are injured in Arkansas shooting
item.description: Adline King, 19, of Blytheville was killed around 11pm Saturday in the shooting on the city's west side. Four other people with gunshot wounds were also treated in a hospital in Tennessee.

item.title: Hota Kotb says Kathie Lee Gifford doesn't see husband Frank Gifford's death as a tragedy
item.description: Kathie Lee says her late husband Frank Gifford's death was 'not a tragedy'. Hoda Kotb told the Today Show hosts that Kathy Lee saw her Hall of Famer husband's life as 'a triumph'.
item.media:description: Hoda Kotb.jpg

item.title: Mother-of-three sues Seattle health clinic for 'wrongful life' after she got pregnant
item.description: Yesenia Pacheco is suing her Seattle community clinic after they gave her a flu shot instead of her birth control injection, resulting in an unwanted pregnancy, KIRO TV reports.

item.title: What the Earth would look like without oceans
item.description: Following half a century of research collating 15,000 samples from ships, the University of Sydney's School of Geosciences has developed an unprecedented impression of the world.
item.media:credit: EarthByte Group, School of Geosciences, University of Sydney, NICTA

item.title: 4,000-year-old skeletons of mother and child found in in Qinghai locked in embrace
item.description: The skeletal remains show how the mother was kneeling on the ground with her arms wrapped around her son as a powerful earthquake hit northwest China in about 2,000 BC.

item.title: Hindu festival stampede at a temple in India leaves 11 dead
item.description: Tens of thousands of worshippers had lined up outside the temple in Deoghar, Jharkhand state, overnight, creating a stampede when the gates opened at dawn on Monday morning.
item.media:description: Police personnel conduct investigations at the site of a stampede by pilgrims at the Baidyanath Jyotirlinga temple complex in Deoghar district of Jharkhand state, about 400 kilometers from Ranchi on August 10, 2015. A stampede outside a Hindu temple killed at least 11 pilgrims in eastern India early on August 10, after a surge in the kilometres-long queue of up to 150,000 people. AFP PHOTO STR/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Virginia family pays $5,475 for lunch after cafe tacks on tip to a $26 meal
item.description: Pallavi Srivastava was touring Life Time Athletic in Reston with her family back in April, and decided to cap off the visit with a meal at the gym's cafe, where they were hit with a surprising charge.

item.title: Serena Williams hits back at sexism in sports after being labeled 'manly' by online trolls
item.description: The 33-year-old tennis champion covers the latest issue, in which she points out that while she has gotten in trouble for her temper in the past, men get away with acting the same way all the time.

item.title: Germany has gained £71billion from its tough stance on Greek debt crisis
item.description: A team at the University of Halle has come up with the sum - around £71bn - by calculating how much the German government would have spent over the past five years had the Greek crisis not happened.
item.media:description:
Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras and German Chancellor Angela Merkel address a press conference following talks at the chancellery in Berlin, Germany on 23 March, 2015.
German Chancellor Angela Merkel (R) and Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras address a press conference following talks at the chancellery in Berlin, on March 23, 2015. AFP PHOTO / TOBIAS SCHWARZ (Photo credit should read TOBIAS SCHWARZ/AFP/Getty Images)

item.title: Police union urges NYPD cops to post photos of homeless people online
item.description: The Sergeants Benevolent Association sent an email to its 5,000 members this week, calling upon the officers to 'utilize your smartphones' and upload the photos to Flickr.

item.title: DA says death penalty for Texas shooter David Conley 'a no-brainer'
item.description: David Ray Conley III, 48, made a brief appearance in court in Houston on Monday after being charged with capital murder in the execution-style deaths of eight people, including his own son.

item.title: Officials admit Colorado mine waste spill was actually THREE TIMES larger than thought
item.description: Environmental Protection Agency officials have said that the spill from Gold King Mine in Colorado actually leaked three million gallons of waste containing zinc, copper, lead and arsenic.

item.title: Diet Pepsi gets rid of aspartame, but will customers return?
item.description: A revamped Diet Pepsi without aspartame is popping up on store shelves. So will people start flocking back to the soda?

item.title: Why you should NEVER put your phone number on Facebook
item.description: British software engineer, Reza Moaiandin, has revealed how anybody can find a person's name, photographs, location and more by typing their phone number into the search bar on Facebook.

item.title: NYC mom charged with murdering her newborn baby after she threw him out window
item.description: Rashida Chowdhury, 21, was being held without bail after her arrest late last week in the death of her month-old son, Rizwan. Chowdhury admitted she threw her baby out the window, police said.

item.title: 53 men, one woman - and a Barbie doll: How a Google search for 'CEO' reveals sexual discrimination is still alive and well in the workplace
item.description: UN Women is spotlighting the ongoing issue of sexual discrimination with a new series of striking ads featuring Google image search results for terms including 'bishop', 'CEO' and 'General'.

item.title: NeuroOn mask helps you avoid jet lag by tricking brain into changing time zones
item.description: NeuroOn (pictured) was designed by Warsaw-based Kamil Adamczyk. It is fitted with sensors that monitor brainwaves, eye movement, oxygen levels and the wearer's body temperature.

item.title: Boston professor accused of shoplifting 20 bottles of cognac 'because he is a black male'
item.description: Robert Johnson, a 66-year-old UMass professor, was accused of shoplifting from Blanchards on Thursday after employees called police and claimed he was the suspect in a March robbery.

item.title: Mexican who led search for remains of the 43 students has been shot dead
item.description: Miguel Angel Jimenez Blanco, 45, was found shot to death in his taxi, in his hometown of Xaltianguis, Mexico. In the wake of the disappearance of 43 students, Jimenez led the search for their remains.

item.title: The plant that could save France's honey bees from 'the hornet from hell'
item.description: Romaric Perrocheau, the head of the botanical gardens in Nantes, France, discovered the North American Sarracenia plant can attract and eat the Asian hornet.

item.title: Elvis Presley's private nurse Letetia Henley Kirk writes a memoir
item.description: West Tennessee woman, Letetia Henley Kirk, who was Elvis Presley's private nurse is releasing a book about her life around the music legend and his family and what it was like living at Graceland.

item.title: Healthy diet including oily fish helps protect children from allergies
item.description: Children who regularly ate oily fish including salmon, mackerel and herring before the age of eight reduced the risk of allergic rhinitis by half, researchers from the Karolinska Institute found.

item.title: Christian Taylor shot dead by rookie cop posts tragic tweet a year before shooting
item.description: Christian Taylor, 19, was shot dead by police after breaking into an Arlington, Texas car dealership on Friday. Surveillance footage shows him trying to break into several cars before being cornered.

item.title: Checking your emails outside of work really IS bad for your health
item.description: People who check their emails outside of work have higher levels of the stress hormone cortisol than those who keep work and leisure separate, University of Hamburg researchers discovered.

item.title: Al Qaeda's Syrian affiliate announces withdrawal to avoid helping US
item.description: Al Qaeda's Syria affiliate, the Al-Nusra Front, announced its withdrawal from frontlines against ISIS along Syria's border with Turkey. US-led coalition hopes to create ISIS-free zone along the border.

item.title: Donald Trump says war with Fox News is over after phone call from Roger Ailes
item.description: On Sunday Trump gave ratings-popping phone interviews to every major network with a weekend political talk show – except Fox – as polls shows he was still on top following 'bloodgate.'
item.media:description: CLEVELAND, OH - AUGUST 06: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump participates in the first prime-time presidential debate hosted by FOX News and Facebook at the Quicken Loans Arena August 6, 2015 in Cleveland, Ohio. The top-ten GOP candidates were selected to participate in the debate based on their rank in an average of the five most recent national political polls. (Photo by Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images)

item.title: ISS astronauts to eat vegetables grown in space in step towards Mars mission
item.description: A crop of lettuce has been harvested from the ISS plant growth system dubbed Veg-01, Nasa's plant experiment being used to study how plants can be grown in micro-gravity.

item.title: Pregnant Jenna Bush Hager moved to tears on the Today show
item.description: The 33-year-old, who has a two-year-old daughter Mila with husband Henry Hager, celebrated the impending birth of her second daughter with the Today show anchors, who showered her with gifts.

item.title: Mexican medical student took selfie next to aseriously ill woman
item.description: A young medical student could be kicked off her course after she allegedly took a selfie of herself smiling over a seriously ill patient in Tamaulipas, Mexico.

item.title: Social media addicts are more likely to feel like failures over careers and looks
item.description: The Future Foundation survey of 5,000 Britons found social media users feel like they were under-performing in four main ways: body image, career, mood, and energy levels.

item.title: Parents of children with chronic illnesses celebrate their kids' return to the classroom in heart-warming picture series
item.description: Children's Healthcare of Atlanta asked families of current and former patients to share photos of their kids, ranging from pre-schoolers to teens, as thousands of children in the South started school.

item.title: Colonel Gaddafi's son appears pale and gaunt in new photograph
item.description: Dressed in blue regulation prison attire, the 42-year-old former commander of Libya's Special Force appeared much older while standing barefoot in a cell at Al-Hadba jail.

item.title: Ikea to switches globally to ‘super-efficient’ Led box
item.description: The Swedish furniture store will become the first major global retailer to offer a 100 per cent 'super-efficient' LED lighting range. Bulbs use 85 per cent less energy than incandescent bulbs.

item.title: Woman ran London marathon WITHOUT a tampon in
item.description: Kiran Gandi, 26, a musician and Harvard graduate, let her period flow freely as she ran around the London Marathon in April earlier this year.

item.title: Mercury Men who control America's air conditioning say debate is not just war between men and women
item.description: Kevin Kampschroer (left) and Steve Sakach are America's so-called Mercury Men, who set the temperature for 2.1million federal workers in their roles at the General Services Administration.

item.title: Hot men drinking wine is the latest Instagram trend to sweep the internet
item.description: Men and Wine, which is run by Milanese wine website Wineophy and currently has 12,500 followers on Instagram, comes hot on the heels of Men and Coffee and Hot Dudes Reading.

item.title: Indian boy with giant hands from local gigantism gets life changing operation
item.description: Mohammad Kaleem, eight, from Jharkhand State, eastern India, was born with a form of giantism which has seen his hands and arms grow until they weighed a colossal two stone between them.

item.title: Lowe's driver Marcus Bradley replaced after customer asks for white employee
item.description: Marcus Bradley, an African American, who has worked for Lowe's Home Improvement for the last 11 years, was left devastated after his manager compiled with the customer's outrageous wish in Virginia.

item.title: NYPD spending $4.5million on Tasers and adding about 1,000 stun guns to arsenal
item.description: Police are expected to add 1,000 more Tasers with the funds, which would also include chargers, power sources and darts. The weapons cost around $500 to $1,000 each and the NYPD already owns 1,700.

item.title: Boy, six, is the sole survivor of horrific car crash in Florida which killed five people
item.description: The crash happened around 7pm along State Road 70 in DeSoto County, near Arcadia. The out-of-control truck ended up crossing the center line and crashing into a nearby Volkswagen.

item.title: Thomas Gilbert Jr who 'killed his father asked prison about yoga class'
item.description: The Princeton graduate accused of shooting dead his wealthy father in their family's Manhattan apartment has been asking about yoga classes at New York City's main jail, Riker's Island.

item.title: Pub-goers share cheeky chalk bar signs on Twitter
item.description: Pub-goers have posted comical chalkboards spotted outside their favourite watering holes under the hashtag, '#barsignoftheday'. The tongue-in-cheek notices are sweeping the internet.

item.title: Debris found in Maldives and believed to be from missing MH370 actually belonged to a capsized BARGE
item.description: The captain of a barge which overturned last February said the items washed up in the Indian Ocean had in fact broken away from his vessel, scotching rumours they were from the Boeing 777.
item.media:description: must clear with legal before using....

item.title: German man who fled Czechoslovakia during Second World War returns to his family home after 70 years and discovers the possessions his father hid in the roof are still there
item.description: Mr Schlattner's lost treasures will now be held in a museum in the town of Usti nad Labem as the Czech government's rules dictate that all German property left behind is now owned by the state.

item.title: 'A white pointer gnawing on my leg - I'll never get that image out of my head': Shark attack survivor describes the horrifying moment he was mauled and left near death
item.description: Shark attack survivor, Craig Ison, has described the horrifying moment he watched an enormous great white latch onto his leg in Northern NSW and tear it to shreds, leaving him in a week long coma.

item.title: Is the world's most scenic highway? China unveils new seven mile road that's built in the middle of a river valley
item.description: New route connects Xingshan County in Hubei to a high-speed motorway. It cuts an hour's journey to just 20 minutes and there's great views en route. It officially opened on August 9.

item.title: Baby hippo calf is mauled to death by pod of hippos in Zimbabwe
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC. A two day old hippo calf has been mauled to death in Zimbabwe after its mother introduced it to the pod and the other hippos turned upon the unfortunate infant.

item.title: Donald Trump still leads Republican GOP primary field after Megyn Kelly scandal
item.description: GOP primary voters were asked who they would back if the vote were held now in the NBC News Online Poll, which put Trump top on 23 per cent despite his comments about Fox News anchor Megyn Kelly.

item.title: Millionaire businessman gives up his possessions to become a Buddhist monk in China after living in isolation for two years
item.description: Liu Jingchong, a businessman from Guangdong Province, moved into the mountains to live in total isolation after an epiphany in 2012 made him desire a 'minimalist life'.
item.media:description: Pic shows: Liu Jingchong. A millionaire who began living in the isolated mountains in north-west China two years ago has fulfilled his dream of becoming a Buddhist monk after giving up all of lifeís material pleasures to pursue a lifestyle driven by spiritual enlightenment. Liu Jingchong, a businessman born in Chinaís southern Guangdong Province, was recently accepted as a monk at Baochan Temple in the county of Hanshan, in east Chinaís Anhui Province, after spending two years living in isolation. The 39-year-old swapped big city life as well as millions in annual income to live a minimalistic life on Zhongnan Mountain in northwestern Shaanxi Province after an epiphany came to him one day, causing him to realise that people will never stop pursuing bigger houses, better jobs, and more expensive cars if they continue to live in metropolises, failing to focus on their "inner" life. He then dropped everything and left for the mountains in December 2012, where he spent most of his days me

item.title: Lookalikes spotted on public transport that are wearing matching outfits too
item.description: These unwitting commuters have taken the Internet by storm after they were captured on camera as they came face-to-face with their doppelgangers on public transport.

item.title: Asian man lets daughter drown in Dubai rather than be touched by 'strange men'
item.description: Lt Col Ahmed Burqibah, Deputy Director of Dubai Police’s Search and Rescue Department, said the girl got into difficulty on a beach in the city.
item.media:description:
Burj Al Arab Hotel Dubai 971.jpg Dubai www.jumeirah.com
free publicity picture

item.title: Bacteria' that EATS nicotine hailed as a 'new anti-smoking drug'
item.description: The enzyme was able to significantly reduce the time nicotine lingered in the blood, preventing it from reaching the brain, where it triggers addiction, Scripps Research Institute experts said.

item.title: Firefighter Michael Hallenbeck dies while battling wildfire in California
item.description: Michael Hallenbeck, 21, of Shingle Springs, California was hit Saturday during the initial attack on a fire that broke out south of the Echo Summit mountain pass, the agency said in a statement Sunday.

item.title: Bizarre moment theatre performers are showered with cash carried by a bulldozer after audience tipped them generously
item.description: Theme park in Hangzhou, China, launched scheme to encourage visitors to see its performance. There was enough cash for a bulldozer but some paid with just food items. The event took place August 9.

item.title: Prohibition's Whiskey Island used by New York City bootleggers for sale at £2m
item.description: The stunning island was used by bootleggers to transport alcohol across the Canadian border to the USA during the 14-year ban, which began in 1919.

item.title: Pace of migrants trying to cross Mediterranean is getting FASTER
item.description: Tens of thousands of people have been making their way from the Turkish coast to nearby Greek islands in inflatable dinghies, overwhelming cash-strapped and understaffed authorities.
item.media:description: Pakistani migrants run in panic off a dinghy as they arrive at a beach on the Greek island of Kos, after crossing a part of the Aegean sea from Turkey, August 10, 2015. United Nations refugee agency (UNHCR) called on Greece to take control of the "total chaos" on Mediterranean islands, where thousands of migrants have landed. About 124,000 have arrived this year by sea, many via Turkey, according to Vincent Cochetel, UNHCR director for Europe. REUTERS/Yannis Behrakis TPX IMAGES OF THE DAY

item.title: Luna Park cable on slingshot ride SNAPPED and sent thrillseekers into the air
item.description: A 24-year-old woman was hospitalised with a broken leg after one of the ride’s cables snapped and a cage was thrown against a support column at Luna Park at Cap d’Agde.

item.title: Husbands celebrate wive's sacrifices on their child's first birthday
item.description: Husbands celebrated mothers and the sacrifices made by their wives on the first birthday of their little one in a heart-warming video filmed in a hospital in Japan.

item.title: Arthur Schneider saved wife Rosemary from house fire in North Carolina
item.description: Arthur Schneider, who has been married to his wife Rosemary for 68 years, ignored the buzzing smoke alarms and high heat to rescue her from the back of their home in Asheboro, North Carolina.

item.title: The Blue Dream Bugatti plane designed 75 years ago to have maiden flight in weeks
item.description: The replica Reve Bleu plane (pictured top and inset) is based on a design penned by Bugatti in 1937, which the car maker was forced to hide to stop the technology falling into the Nazi's hands.

item.title: Google, Facebook and Twitter in new crackdown on child abuse image online
item.description: British charity Internet Watch Foundation (IWF) is creating 'digital fingerprints' of the vile pictures so that they can be pulled from the internet wherever they are posted

item.title: Body of rugby star Wasim Thajudeen is exhumed amid claims he was murdered
item.description: A Colombo magistrate ordered a new murder investigation into the May 2012 killing of Wasim Thajudeen after police said they had fresh evidence suggesting he had been tortured and killed.
item.media:description: 19 Nov 2010, Colombo, Sri Lanka --- Sri Lankan President Mahinda Rajapaksa (C) prays with his son Yoshitha (L), and wife Shiranthi before taking the oath of office for a second term, in Colombo November 19, 2010. Rajapaksa took oath for his second six-year term on Friday after having won elections in January defeating his former Army Commander who along with him helped to win a 25-year war. REUTERS/Andrew Caballero-Reynolds (SRI LANKA - Tags: POLITICS ELECTIONS) --- Image by © ANDREW CABALLERO-REYNOLDS/Reuters/Corbis

item.title: Pocahontas' Native American tribe finally given federal recognition
item.description: Despite them having lived on the same 1,200 acre stretch of land in Virginia for centuries longer than the U.S. has even existed, the federal government has long overlooked the Pamunkey tribe (pictured).

item.title: De-clutter, buy a plant and listen to music: How to turn your workspace into a productive zone
item.description: Whether you work in a tiny cubicle or a private corner office, the way you organize the area where you work can make a significant difference to your productivity.

item.title: Cheeky three-year-old smashes a board to earn his Taekwondo white belt
item.description: A determined youngster earned his white belt in Taekwondo after successfully breaking a wooden board with his foot in hilarious footage recorded in California.

item.title: Chinese train attendant gets beaten up but only receives £20 compensation
item.description: Unnamed attendant was travelling between Changsa and Nanchang in central China on August 4. She shared pictures of her injuries on Weibo, which received over 500,000 views.

item.title: World's population will soar to 11 billion by 2100 and HALF will live in Africa
item.description: The predictions were made by John Wilmoth, the director of the United Nations Population Division, at the 2015 Joint Statistical Meetings in Seattle. Stock image of a crowd in Nigeria.

item.title: Online retailer AliExpress faces backlash over using slim model to sell plus-size leggings
item.description: AliExpress's plus-size clothing listing has provoked outrage online after it used a slim model to sell size 3XL and 5XL leggings. The seller listed another item under 'Big Size Women Pants.'

item.title: Terror in Turkey as attacks on US consulate and a police station rock Istanbul
item.description: Two militants, including a woman was later captured, launched a gun attack on the US consulate after a suicide bomber detonated a vehicle at a police station in the Sultanbeyli district of the city.

item.title: Underwater Stonehenge-style rock found off Sicily coast in the Mediterranean Sea
item.description: The Stonehenge-style monument, found 37 miles (60km) off the coast of Sicily, could shed light on the earliest civilisations to call the Mediterranean basin home.

item.title: Federal lawsuit could reveal evidence of Saudi complicity in 9/11
item.description: A congressional intelligence report had the pages redacted but now the two men who authored them are likely to be called to testify as part of a lawsuit brought by victims' families against the Saudi government.

item.title: Toddler with Downs' syndrome signs with Models of Diversity to strut the catwalk
item.description: Louis Killick, from Surrey, has just walked in his very first catwalk show and his mother Anita, 43, says she couldn't be more proud of him - and is calling on agencies to recruit more 'children who are different'.

item.title: Seeking Arrangements reveal rich men seek blonde-haired students with 32D busts
item.description: The findings have been revealed by the company that matches wealthy male benefactors with young, attractive females - after it collected data from 486,000 of its online users.

item.title: Cyclist Matt Brammeier smashes into car after taking corner too fast in US race
item.description: Professional cyclist Matt Brammeier was hospitalised after he collided with a support car at high speed during the Tour of Utah – and the horrific footage was captured on camera.

item.title: Apprentice contestant defends of Donald Trump after 'sexist' attack on Megyn Kelly
item.description: Omarosa Manigault-Stallworth called Megyn Kelly's questioning 'equivalent to going through somebody's trash and cherry-picking', and described it as 'the lowest form of journalism'.

item.title: The formula to cook a perfect burger revealed
item.description: The perfect burger should be cooked for 9.5 minutes, only be flipped once, have toppings that weigh 60 per cent of the final creation and be hand-pressed to 1.5cm thickness, according to experts.

item.title: Is this the weirdest advert ever? Models flash their underwear to promote Japanese music channel in one of the strangest - and definitely the cheekiest! - commercials on TV
item.description: Japanese music television channel Space Shower TV used sound pressure from powerful amplifiers to lift the skirts of models in one of the most bizarre adverts you are ever likely to see.

item.title: Jayne McCool creates her own cake versions of fast-food like McDonald's and KFC
item.description: Jayne McCool, from Bulwell, Nottingham, makes the elaborate cakes for her family and friends. The 45-year-old pastry chef has been dubbed Super-Gran for her amazing baking abilities.

item.title: South Korea plans accuses for North Korea of landmine attack
item.description: South Korea has accused the North of planting landmines that maimed two soldiers at the border. Seoul has urged Pyongyang to apologise for the attack, and punish those responsible.

item.title: Whitney Weldon suffers Stone Man Syndrome causing muscles to form second skeleton
item.description: Whitney Weldon, 23, of New Jersey, was diagnosed with fibrodysplasia ossificans progressive (FOP) when she was nine, one of the rarest and most disabling medical conditions.

item.title: Beauty perfectors promising to hide large pores, smooth texture and blur wrinkles
item.description: Forever Beautiful columnist Elsa McAlonan reveals the latest batch of incredible 'quick fix' products that contain microparticles to deflect light from imperfections on the skin's surface.

item.title: Lioness fights off male rival after he threatened her cub in South Africa
item.description: This is the dramatic moment a lioness ran at and attacked a male lion at the Kruger National Park in South Africa in order to ensure the safety of her cub.

item.title: French family left girl, 3, in motorway layby and drove 90m before realising
item.description: The child was found by other holidaymakers off the A7, near Loriol in southern France on Sunday, telling them that she was 'going to the seaside' when she saw 'daddy's car pull away'.
item.media:description: Locator map for couple who drove 150km from Loriol to Aix-en-Provence without realising they'd left their 3-year-old daughter behind

item.title: Weight-loss expert Sophie Claessens reveals the healthiest way to cook your food
item.description: Dietitian Sophie Claessens explores cooking methods from boiling to steaming, poaching to roasting, highlighting how to get the best from your raw ingredients.

item.title: 'A Bikini A Day' model Natasha Oakley shares her beach body confidence secrets
item.description: Australian swimwear model Natasha Oakley has shared her beach body confidence secrets. The 24-year-old runs a bikini appreciation blog with Devin Brugman.

item.title: Black hole 'fountain' gives birth to stars and explains mystery of how galaxies grow
item.description: Researchers at Michigan State University and Yale University have shown how hot jets and cooling gas regulates star formation (pictured) in elliptical galaxies like a thermostat in the home.

item.title: Bangladesh police kill 6 alleged tiger poachers in gunfight
item.description: Police recovered pelts from three adult tigers from the alleged poachers' camp in the Bangladesh part of the Sundarbans mangrove forest, home to the critically endangered Bengal tiger, on Sunday.
item.media:description:
Television programme: Growing Up Wild: Natural World, Picture Shows: Bengal Tiger (Panthera tigris tigris) with cubs in water.
(C) Andy Rouse - Photographer: Andy Rouse

item.title: Porn shown at Brazilian bus station after hackers infiltrate display screens
item.description: The sex footage was shown on screens that normally display arrival and departure times for passengers at the Boqueirao station in the Brazilian city of Curitiba.

item.title: Apple's iOS 9 will automatically switch between Wi-Fi and mobile data
item.description: The feature is called Wi-Fi Assist and it can be enabled in the Settings menu in iOS 9 (pictured). Apple is expected to roll out iOS 9 to all users later this year.

item.title: ISIS fighters in Afghanistan kill 10 prisoners accused of 'apostasy'
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT. They have burnt men alive and drowned prisoners in metal cages but now ISIS have shown off their new horrific method of committing murder in Afghanistan.

item.title: Always opt for matching sets, don stockings but NEVER wear a corset or thong: Men reveal how women should be dressing to impress in the bedroom
item.description: The vast majority of both men and women polled agreed that underwear affects how attractive they find the opposite sex, according to new research.
item.media:description: 12 Dec 2012 --- Woman tying stockings to garter --- Image by © James Lightbown/cultura/Corbis

item.title: American Airlines passenger records FLAMES shooting out of plane's engine
item.description: Witnesses on the ground called 911 to report a plane in distress, and flight 669 was forced to make an emergency landing at Philadelphia's airport with 133 passengers and five crew members on board.

item.title: Rachael Lilienthal whose arm was torn off by alligator is a Spanish lecturer in Florida
item.description: Rachel Lilienthal has been identified as the woman who was enjoying the water in the Wekiva River, in Florida, on Saturday when she was dragged under the water by a huge alligator.
